Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development and two Florida regulators announced a settlement with First American Title Insurance Company for alleged violations of the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act and similar state laws. HUD, the Florida Department of Financial Services  and the Florida Office of Insurance Regulation alleged that First American made payments to scores of affiliated partnerships based on the referral of business to the title company.

The Department of Housing and Urban Development announced a legal settlement with a Tennessee title company for violating the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act (RESPA). HUD claimed First American Title Insurance Company, doing business as Memphis Title Company, made payments through sham affiliated businesses in the Memphis area in violation of RESPA's anti-kickback and unearned fee provisions.

Company: The First American Title Insurance, Co.
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: A group of title companies agreed to pay a total of $50 million to settle allegations that they engaged in deceptive advertising and unfair business practices in their escrow services.

First American Title Insurance agreed to pay a $500,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations it set up affiliated companies, in part ownership with referral partners, and then violated federal and state law when it paid kickbacks to encourage referral partners to provide First American with title insurance business, used unlicensed referral partners, and failed to ensure that referral partners properly disclosed their affiliated business relationship to customers.

Company: First American Title Insurance Company of Oregon
First American Title Insurance Company of Oregon

Description: First American Title agreed to pay a $1 million penalty and $185,000 costs in settlement of alleged violations of conflict of interest regulations by one of its representatives alleged to have provided illegal benefits to real estate agents to promote title insurance.

The Securities and Exchange Commission announced settled charges against real estate settlement services company First American Financial Corporation for disclosure controls and procedures violations related to a cybersecurity vulnerability that exposed sensitive customer information.

Company: First American Title Insurance Company of Louisiana

Agency: South Coast (CA) Air Quality Management District
South Coast (CA) Air Quality Management District
